title: [cobirds] Timnath Reservoir/Larimer
content:
Hi all
TImnath Reservoir has drawn down a lot and has lots of birds--mostly on north side of reservoir.  Couldn't pick out anything unusual.  Lots of ducks ("billion" coots); gulls (usuals), some Forster's Terns; grebes, pelicans, cormorants, herons, few Wilson's Warblers.  It seems the marsh is inaccessible--road was blocked from south and looks like they are doing some heavy roadwork right in front of marsh viewing area.  Didn't see any signs (yet) that say "Timnath residents only" for park on south.
Thanks Gary Lefko, Nunn
http://coloradobirder.ning.com/
